result.execSummary:
The defendant Xavier X Grose Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (21 pages) SENTENCING commencing JANUARY 28, 2016, received and filed.
Scanned: State Subpoena.

Defendant Xavier X Grose in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Defendant Xavier X Grose in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  

As to Count 1:
Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 28 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prison, with credit for 385 days served. Court ordered 14 MONTHS Initial Term Of Confinement and 14 MONTHS Extended Supervision.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Parenting classes.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-3rd party contact for the purpose of time with child(ren) as approved by agent.
-No contact with firearms.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges and supervision fees. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Defendant Xavier X Grose in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Defendant Xavier X Grose in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Additional statement by: Stephanie L. 

As to Count 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.

As to Counts 2-6:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in. 

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 38. Sentencing scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson in court, defendant Xavier X Grose not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was not produced from the House of Correction for today's court appearance.  Case is adjourned to 1-26-2016 at 8:15 for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson in court, defendant Xavier X Grose not in court, in custody.  Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion papers not filed.  Parties requests a plea hearing prior to the scheduled jury trial date.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Letter from Atty Christopherson as to status of motion
Scanned Sealed Documents.vmb

Defendant Xavier X Grose in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Defendant Xavier X Grose in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are prepared to proceed to trial.  Defense counsel informs the court that expert witness, Dr. Lundh, is unable to return after today and without objection from the state will be called out of order to testify.  Extensive in chambers discussion is held.
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  11:45am.  Panel is releaesed for lunch and directed to return at 1:15pm.
All parties are present in court at 1:15.  Defense counsel informs the court that over the lunch recess she received additional information and now believes that a Shiffra-Green hearing will be needed.  The court will proceed with voir dire and a recess will be taken to determine if that is necessary.
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and excused to jury room.  Based on time constraints for doctor to testify today the court will adjourn to another trial date and will set matter for a Shiffra-Green hearing on 12-22-2015.  Defense is to file motion and supporting affidavit by 11-9-2015 and the state is to respond by 12-7-2015.
The court orders that all subpoenas are continued to the next trial date of 2-8-2016 at 8:15am.
The court releases jury from further service on today's date.

FILED RETAINED IN COURTROOM.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Xavier X Grose in court with Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Defendant Xavier X Grose in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Final pre-trial held with the parties.
Defense counsel requests that case remain scheduled for trial.  Case remains scheduled for trial in Branch 38.
Clerk:  jms
of Expert Testimony and Amended Witness List filed by defense

Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson in court, defendant Xavier X Grose not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court is advised that a BELLOWS motion was held in Children's Court and granted by Judge Dwyer. The state is directed to get all the information for the court by the next date of 10-22-2015.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson in court, defendant Xavier X Grose not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is requesting another final pretrial closer to trial date of 10-26-2015.  Counsel informs the court that there is a BELLOWS motion pending before Judge Dwyer on 10-15-2015. 
Defense is requesting a reduction in bail to which the state objects.  The court will not modify bail any further.  Court sets another final pretrial on 10-20-2015.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Motion for Hearing Regarding Bail Modification filed by defense.
Court ordered defendant to have no contact with Stephanie L., or her children, unless approved by Children's Curt and supervised by an adult.   mld

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  Drug testing, breathalyzer tests, absolute sobriety, no guns, no possession or use of controlled substance without a valid prescription.   Absolutely no release from home (24 hour curfew).  Release for legal appointments.   mld

Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson in court, defendant Xavier X Grose not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was not produced for today's proceedings.  The Court will accept a written waiver from defendant that waives the Speedy Trial as requested by defense counsel on 7-14-2015.  Defense counsel will obtain the waiver and submit to the Court.  

The Court heard and granted Defense Motion to Modify Bail.  Court amended bail to $3,500.00 with gps supervision.

Case remains calendared for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 38 on 9-25-2015 at 8:15 am and Jury Trial on 10-26-2015 at 8:15 am.   mld

Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson in court, defendant Xavier X Grose not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Hon. Jeffrey Kremers for the Hon. Mel Flanagan.
Today, medical records were turned over to defense counsel from the State.  Defense counsel waives the Speedy Jury Trial.  Court heard and granted defense motion to adjourn Jury Trial.  Case adjourned for Bail / Bond hearing in Branch 4 on 7-22-2015 at 1:30 pm.  *** DEFENDANT TO BE PRODUCED FOR THE BAIL / BOND HEARING ON 7-22-2015.

Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 38 on 9-25-2015 at 8:15 am and Jury Trial on 10-26-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.   mld

Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson in court, defendant Xavier X Grose not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Defense counsel has received partial discovery and offer.  Upon receipt, the State will forward the medical records to defense counsel.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 4-9-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, received and filed.   mld

Attorney Scott Phillips in court, defendant Xavier X Grose not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court advised by Attorney Jane Christopherson, who was present, that she was just retained by defendant as new counsel.  For the reasons as stated on the record, subject to receiving written confirmation, motion of defense counsel to withdraw is heard and granted by the Court.  Written confirmation to be submited by Attorney Christopherson.  Prior counsel turned over the discovery to new counsel.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 3-17-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Xavier X Grose in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Defendant Xavier X Grose in custody.  Nicholas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Harold Almas-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Stephanie L

Defendant Xavier X Grose in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Xavier X Grose in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 2, 3, 5 & 6.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
